storyInfo: Ebenholz and Kreide's performance does not gain Czerny's favor. Consequently, Ebenholz leaves to visit Gertrude, concert sponsor, where he learns of a plan she's had waiting in the wings.

attributes.content: I'm so sorry I'm late...
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: This is the selections! If you were tardier by twenty minutes, we'd be hand in hand as we waltzed home!
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: I'm sorry...
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: Would you mind quickly explaining yourself?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: My... grandpa went missing this morning, actually.
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: Missing?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Nothing terribly serious. I found him in the Afterglow in an alley, and he said he was just up too early, out for a walk.
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: For a walk, the whole time until you arrived here?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: No, no, I went to Rhodes Island this morning too, for the admission procedures.
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: With your grandfather? At the Rhodes Island office?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: I recall Rhodes Island having only a miniscule branch in Vyseheim. They couldn't be admitting patients.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: They couldn't, but Hibiscus gave up her own bed, and she promised she'd put my grandpa's health first.
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: Hmph... A charming tale, but that cost you a pretty penny, didn't it?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: They took the money this morning. It was less than half of what you gave me yesterday.
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: Well, well. You'll have to check regularly on your grandpa, then, so they don't trim corners where you're not looking.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: 'Trim corners?'
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: They're a business, after all. Their profits have to come from the sick, if they admit them on such low fees. Say, a little from their meals, a little from their equipment and medication—
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: I don't think that's what's happening.
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: And how do you know?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Yesterday afternoon, they gave him medicine to take before I'd paid anything.
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: And Hibiscus spared some food for me this morning. I only turned her down because I was so short on time.
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: Such a meticulous performance. Surely your grandpa was unwilling to go precisely because he could see that.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: I get it. I'll be checking in on him as much as I can.
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: Thank you.
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: Thank me?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: I know you're taking pains to tell me all this because you're worried me or my grandfather will be hurt.
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: Never mind. Let's move on.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: What did you think of the score after picking it up last night?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: I—
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: Next entry, Ebenholz and Kreide!
attributes.name: Mannered Infected

attributes.content: Come.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Czerny is overseeing the selections today in person. We can't afford to embarrass ourselves.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Greetings, Herr Czerny.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: No need for pleasantries. Go on, begin.
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: The selections are quite unlike the applications, where crowds thronged the seats to watch. Save for a scant few staff, only Czerny and the entrants are present.
If yesterday's audience was present, the majority would be applauding this brief ensemble piece until their hands were raw.
But here and now, as the final lingering notes fall away, the look on Czerny's face is fearsome.
Herr Czerny?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: You haven't practiced much, have you?
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: As you surmised, but—
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: It smacks too strongly of being scrabbled together, you on your flute and him on his cello. There's almost no sense of coordination.
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: Especially from you. You were stuck fast to your own tempo, completely ignoring what the cello emoted during his melodic passage. Conversely, you forced him to accommodate for you instead.
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: If you hadn't realized in time, you would have ruined the entire passage.
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: I would have ruined the entire passage?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: No, I feel you may not have heard quite clearly...
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: I'm sat right here, and you tell me I don't hear clearly? You think something's wrong with my hearing?
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: Herr Czerny, Ebenholz doesn't mean to offend you, he just...
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: Just what? All I see is someone too coddled by flattery.
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: Coddled by flattery?! You know nothing of my circumstances, I ask you to rescind—
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: (Hisses) Ebenholz!
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: I will consider Kreide. You may leave. Next.
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: What did you say? Do you imply even he—
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: —Herr Czerny.
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: Hm?
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: If Ebenholz isn't allowed to perform, then I can't be in this concert either.
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: What's forcing you to speak for him?
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: Ebenholz has been a huge help to me, so...
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: I'm sorry, but this concert won't sink for losing one potential cellist, and losing one pot-stirrer of a Lord will pain me even less.
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: Next!
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: Scoundrel! Who does he think he is? So flippant just because he's played a piano, written a piece or two?!
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Calm down, come on.
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: How am I meant to be calm? What kind of attitude was that? 'Coddled by flattery?' I'm a fine, upstanding man. Who's ever coddled me? Give me a name!
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: I think there was just a small misunderstanding between you. Surely Herr Czerny didn't think we were that lousy...
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: Of course you weren't lousy, that was me! Did you forget what he said? 'I will consider Kreide. You may leave!'
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: I think the sooner you apologize to him, the better. He might just let us try again.
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: There's always some way, and it doesn't have to include humbling myself so badly before him!
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: But... I can't think of anything that'd help other than an apology...
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: (Takes a deep breath)
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: You return home, in any case. I'll be returning to my residence to contemplate what to do.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: If there really is no alternative, then we'll seek out Czerny.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Well... alright, then.
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: 'Coddled by flattery'...
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: This musician knows nothing, and he dares prattle...
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Tch!
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: (There's the headache again...)
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Useless fake...
attributes.name: Voice from Nowhere

attributes.content: Even the lowly blight-wracked commoners loathe the vulgar sound of your flute...
attributes.name: Voice from Nowhere

attributes.content: You shut up right now!
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Mein Herr, we may not be acquainted, but you seem to be in need of some help?
attributes.name: Fretful Noble

attributes.content: Not at all... I appreciate the trouble.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Erm...
attributes.name: Fretful Noble

attributes.content: (He really is hers—)
attributes.name: Fretful Noble

attributes.content: Pardon my insolence.
attributes.name: Fretful Noble

attributes.content: Oh, so it's you. Do you feel unwell?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Er? You—what did you say? No, not at all.
attributes.name: Fretful Noble

attributes.content: Really? Your face looks somewhat sickly to me.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Of course not, haha, hahahaha...
attributes.name: Fretful Noble

attributes.content: Pardon me, pardon me...
attributes.name: Fretful Noble

attributes.content: Your headaches are flaring up again?
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: It's fine. It's more or less faded by now.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: I'm sorry.
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: What are you apologizing to me for?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: I was so inconsiderate as to cause you embarrassment at the selections today, and give you a headache at that.
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: You were so inconsiderate?
attributes.name: Ebenholz
Ebenholz
attributes.content: How did you know——

attributes.name: Ebenholz
attributes.content: No, in fact it's only natural for you to know it.
Indeed. For better or worse, I am one of the sponsors of this concert, and news about it reaches me fast, Herr Ebenholz.
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: You needn't worry. This is nothing major.
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: In fact, I hear Czerny didn't assess you two badly at all. He intentionally designated you as backups for 'Morgen und Abend.'
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: Really?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: We are more or less friends. I have him worked out to an extent.
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: He's a famed artist, after all, come rain or shine, and Infected too. His temper flared up. Please, excuse him.
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: Hmph.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: I do have my influence over this concert. You and Kreide can practice; I'll do Czerny's work.
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: I'd rather redo the selections than have you exercise your sway, to be honest. This morning was merely an aberration in performance.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Of course, of course.
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: Still, you needn't let this perturb you so badly.
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: Tea? We have a citrus-flavored black tea today. They say it does good things for headaches.
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: Thank you very much.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: How is it?
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: Fragrant. I appreciate the hospitality.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Well, then, moving on. Listen closely, please.
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: As you'd anticipated, my inviting you to Vyseheim, for a concert in the Infected settlement, does come with ulterior motives.
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: You don't seem too bowled over.
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: I'm used to being exploited by now.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: It would've surprised me more if you had no other motive.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: In that case, I'll be straightforward.
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: I have a plan that's been a long time ready.
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: If you act according to this plan, I have great certainty I can free you from the 'Voice of the Mundane.'
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: —What did you say?!
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: The Voice of the Mundane, Herr Ebenholz. The root of your many misfortunes, one of the legal grounds on which you possess Grafschaft of Urtica, the—
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: I don't need you to explain what the Voice of the Mundane is. The thing has been inside my head all this time, tormenting me when it sees fit.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: What I need you to expound on is the details of this plan.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: It's very simple. Just perform at Herr Czerny's concert as an ensemble with your fresh acquaintance Herr Kreide, and that will suffice.
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: Out of sheerest kindness, I'll treat this as a poor joke, Dame Gertrude.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: This is in no way a joke.
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: Just like you, Kreide harbors the Voice of the Mundane within him.
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: Him? The Voice of the Mundane?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: The Twin Empresses made it explicit that I was the only one left who carried it!
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: That merely shows there are things even they don't know. To boot, it isn't even that rare.
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: Two Voices of the Mundane need only come close enough in space in order for 'Resonanz' to occur, and this sonority will amplify both your Arts as it occurs. That is the basis of my plan.
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: Beyond amplifying your Arts, Resonanz is its own kind of powerful energy, and *this* energy will be massively intensified when you two perform in ensemble.
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: It just needs the appropriate induction, and I'll be able to make use of this energy to transfer your Voice of the Mundane into him.
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: Then what will happen to Kreide?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Fear not. I'll handle that as deemed fit.
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: I still don't understand, though. Why does it have to be Czerny's concert?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: I'll duet with Kreide at his home, you come induce this resonance, and you transfer my Voice of the Mundane into him. Won't that work?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: The induction of Resonanz is a delicate art. Alone without the Afterglow Hall, I wouldn't be able to do it.
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: The Afterglow Hall?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Didn't you know? Construction of the Afterglow Hall was completed under the Witch King's supervision.
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: I never heard.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Being a building he ordered in the twilight of his reign, the materials and architecture employed in the Hall share many resemblances to his Spire.
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: It wasn't meant as the concert hall it is, synonymous with the Infected district. It was meant as a fortress of Arts, a nightmare to terrify His Majesty's enemies.
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: I've overstepped my bounds in doing so, but I do require the Afterglow Hall aid me in conducting the Resonanz's energy, so we can ultimately eliminate the Voice of Mundane that dwells in your body.
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: Do you have any other questions about the detail of this plan?
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: After it's done, I will handle Kreide and any other remaining trifles. You need only hide for a suitable length of time.
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: Once it all blows over, you can escape your unbearable nobility once and for all, and become a free civilian.
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: Of course, if you aren't alright accepting such ready freedom, I won't force you, and I certainly won't make an enemy of you on the grounds that you know my plan.
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: Whether you wish to remain in Vyseheim until the concert concludes, or return immediately to Urtica, I will not stop you.
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: You won't stop me...
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: You're the first to want to rid me of the Voice of Mundane, rather than exploit it.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Just what are you hoping to gain from me?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: A powerful assistance.
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: A what?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: I'm just a puppet Graf. I can't even manage my own fiefs personally.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: After your supposed plan succeeds, I'll be no more than an unidentified civilian. What powerful assistance?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Fiefs, armies, even Originium Arts... none of that is important.
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: What's important is the Graf Urtica gone missing, even declared dead.
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: Think of it. How will the Leithanian public opinion respond when at the right juncture, the Graf Urtica returns from the grave?
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: To 'return from the grave.' That's the greatest aid you could ever lend me.
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: I understand.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Please... allow me some time alone, Dame Gertrude.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: I'd be glad to.
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: If you wish to travel anywhere, don't hesitate to tell the servants outside.
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: Farewell.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Farewell. May your decision be the one that suits your interests.
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: Hello.
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: Listen. You must watch whatever happens between Kreide and Rhodes Island closely.
You may disrupt Rhodes Island's movements when necessary, but remember never to alert them at any cost. Direct military conflict is forbidden.
Understood.
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: Allow me to report to you on Graf Urtica's circumstances...
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: You can save it. We know.
This is your plan. If you feel the need to expound on minor matters like this, we'll simply send someone to put you back on track.
Apologies, I was not considerate.
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: Ebenholz will be easy enough, but Kreide and Rhodes Island...
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: I'd forgot. I have what I need, ready and waiting.
attributes.name: Gertrude
